label: sea
subClassOf [LABEL]: some hydrosphere| some sea water|marine water body
SYNONYMS: channel|closed sea|marginal sea|open sea|open sound|open water
definition: A large expanse of saline water usually connected with an ocean.

label: water body
subClassOf [LABEL]: some hydrosphere| some water accumulation process|water mass
SYNONYMS: aquatic feature|bodies of water|body of water|body of water|hydrographic feature|waterbody
definition: An accumulation of water of varying size.

label: solid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of solid material.

label: shore
subClassOf [LABEL]: some coast| some water body|surface landform
definition: That part of the land in immediate contact with a body of water including the area between high and low water lines.

label: depressed landform
definition: A landform sunken or depressed below the surrounding area.

label: sea floor
SYNONYMS: Meeresboden|SeaFloor|fondale marino|fondo marino|ocean floor|ocean floor|sea bed|seabed|seafloor|海床|海底
definition: A marine bed which lies below a sea.

label: shoreline
definition: A two-dimensional continuant fiat boundary which is located between a landmass and a water body.

label: submerged bed
subClassOf [LABEL]: some depressed landform| some water body|solid surface layer
definition: The portion of the ground surface which lies below water.

label: landfill
SYNONYMS: Deponie|discarica|disposal site|garbage dump|rubbish dump|vertedero|垃圾掩埋場
definition: A depression which contains objects and materials discarded by humans or their technologies.

label: marine water body
definition: A lentic water body which is composed primarily of marine water.

label: slope
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the planetary surface between the peak of an elevation or the bottom of a depression and relatively flat surrounding land.

label: liquid water
definition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.

label: saline water
definition: Water which contains a significant concentration of dissolved salts.

label: sea water
definition: Water which has physicochemical properties that have been determined by the processes occuring in a sea or ocean.

label: waste material
definition: A material which is not the desired output of a process and which is typically the input of a process which removes it from its producer (e.g. a disposal process).

label: manufactured product
definition: A material entity that has been processed by humans or their technology in any way, including intermediate products as well as final products.

label: environmental material
definition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.

label: surface layer
definition: A layer of some material entity which is adjacent to one or more of its external boundaries and directly interacts with its immediate surroundings.

label: environmental system
definition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.

label: layer
definition: A material entity which 1) is spatially continuous, 2) is composed of material of comparable thickness, composition, and physical properties, and 3) is physically distinct from adjacent portions of environmental material.

label: marine environment
definition: A marine environment and enviroment which is determined by a marine water body.

label: lentic water body
definition: A lentic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, has very little to no directed flow.

label: planetary landmass
subClassOf [LABEL]: some planet| some solid environmental material|landmass
definition: A landmass which is part of a planet.

label: outer space
definition: Outer space is a hard vacuum containing a low density of particles, predominantly a plasma of hydrogen and helium as well as electromagnetic radiation, magnetic fields, neutrinos, dust and cosmic rays that exists between celestial bodies.

label: waste role
definition: A role that is realized in some process wherein the bearer is discarded or not utilized further.

label: water mass
definition: A mass of water.

label: coast
definition: A coast is the area where land meets the sea, ocean, or lake.

label: recycling process
SYNONYMS: Recycling-Prozess|proceso de reciclaje|processo di riciclo|資源回收
definition: A process during which materials deemed as waste are separated and converted into a form which can be used as input by the same processes which generated them.

label: piece of plastic
definition: A mass of solid material which is primarily composed of plastic.

label: nurdle
definition: A plastic pellet which is produced such that its size allows it to be rapidly melted and used as input for further downstream manufacturing processes.

label: astronomical body
definition: An object which is naturally occuring, bound together by gravitational or electromagnetic forces, and surrounded by space.

label: planet
definition: A planet is an astronomical body orbiting a star or stellar remnant that is massive enough to be rounded by its own gravity, is not massive enough to cause thermonuclear fusion, and has cleared its neighbouring region of planetesimals.

label: astronomical object
subClassOf [LABEL]: some astronomical body| some geodiversity|surrounded by some outer space
definition: An object which is composed of one or more gravitationally bound structures that are associated with a position in space.

label: astronomical body part
definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

label: solid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a solid state.

label: liquid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a liquid state.

label: hydrosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water|liquid astronomical body part
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of the combined mass of water found on, under, and over the surface of a planet.

label: microplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which has a diameter less than five millimetres.

label: primary microplastic particle
definition: A microplastic particle which is the direct output of a manufacturing process.

label: secondary microplastic particle
definition: A microplastic particle which is derived from the breakdown of larger plastic debris.

label: anthropisation
definition: A process during which a natural environmental system is altered by human action.

label: manufacturing process
definition: A planned process during which raw or recycled materials are transformed into products for use or sale using labour and machines, tools, chemical and biological processing, or formulation.

label: ecosystem
definition: An environmental system which includes both living and non-living components.

label: geodiversity
definition: A quality which inheres in a astronomical body or astronomical body part by virtue of the variation in its material composition, participation in geological processes, and the variation in is land- and hydroforms.

label: active ecosystem management process
definition: A process during which an ecosystem, its parts, or the processes it participates in are modified by human intervention to accomplish an objective.

label: water surface
SYNONYMS: surface of a body of water|water body surface
definition: The surface layer of a volume of water.

label: water accumulation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water| some water body|liquid accumulation process
definition: A process during which liquid water accumulates in a site, most often in some form of container.

label: waste disposal process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some material transport process| some waste material|pollution control
SYNONYMS: Abfallentsorgungsprozess|proceso de eliminación de residuos|processo di smaltimento rifiuti
definition: A process during which materials deemed to be waste are transported away from a site.

label: liquid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of some liquid.

label: solid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of solid environmental material.

label: marine bed
definition: A submerged bed which underlies a marine water body.

label: anthropogenic ecosystem conversion process
definition: A process during which an ecosystem - natural or anthropised - is changed by the actions of humans.

label: planned environmental usage process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some active ecosystem management process| some anthropisation
definition: A planned process during which humans access and obtain resources, benefits, or services from a natural or anthropised ecosystem.

label: body of liquid
definition: A liquid astronomical body part which is continuous and is delimited by physical discontinuities or non-liquid boundaries.

label: liquid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of liquid material.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of fluid.

label: surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer where the solid or liquid material of an astronomical body comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: surface layer of a water body
definition: A water surface that is part of a water body.

label: sea surface layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: surface layer of a water body
definition: A surface layer which is part of an ocean or sea.

label: fluid surface layer
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of some liquid or gas.

label: interface layer
definition: A layer which separates two portions of environmental material which possess 1) differing compositions, 2) a discontinuity of some property, or 3) some derivative of some property in a direction normal to the interface.

label: landmass
definition: A large continuous area of land, either surrounded by sea or contiguous with another landmass.

label: land
subClassOf [LABEL]: some solid environmental material|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of solid material and is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.

label: liquid accumulation process
definition: A material accumulation process during which the volume of liquid entity increases.

label: surface landform
definition: A landform which occurs on the surface of an astronomical body.

label: landform
definition: A solid astronomical body part which has been formed from and is composed primarily of the matter of that astronomical body.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is unable to resist shear forces and continuously deforms when subject to them.

label: environmental system process
definition: A process in which includes the components of an environmental system as participants.

label: anthropogenic modulatory intervention process
definition: A process during which humans apply technology to alter the magnitude, duration, rate, or impact of an environmental process.

label: anthropogenic environmental process
definition: An environmental process which is driven by the action of humans.

label: environmental pollution
definition: An environmental system process that results in the introduction of contaminants into an environment.

label: plastic pollution
definition: A pollution process during which plastic contaminants are released into an environmental material.

label: pollution control
definition: A planned process during which the amount of pollutants released into an environmental system is regulated.

label: material accumulation process
definition: A process during which the mass of one or more materials, present within a given site, increases.

label: material transport process
definition: A process during which material is displaced from its original location and transported either to a new location or back to the original location.

label: material transformation process
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental material| some environmental material|environmental system process
definition: A process during which a portion of some environmental material is converted into a different material or a collection of materials.

label: anthropogenic litter
definition: A material entity which has been discarded outside waste management systems by humans or their technologies.

label: thermoplasticity
definition: A disposition inhering in a bearer by virtue of that bearer's ability to, repeatedly, become plastic on heating and harden again on cooling.

label: thermoplastic material
definition: An environmental material which is capable of, repeatedly, becoming plastic when heated and hardening again when cooled.

label: thermosetting disposition
definition: A disposition which inheres in materials capable of becoming rigid when cured by heating.

label: thermoset polymer
definition: A polymer which has been irreversibly hardened by heat-induced curing.

label: piece of plastic foam
definition: A piece of plastic which has a matrix- or sponge-like structure with numerous, hollow internal spaces.

label: plastic film
SYNONYMS: Kunststofffolie|Plastikfolie|pellicola di plastica|película de plástico|plastic membrane|plastic sheet
definition: A piece of plastic which is flexible, thin, and planar.

label: plastic fragment
SYNONYMS: Plastikfragment|fragmento de plástico|frammento di plastica|plastic flake|plastic granule
definition: A piece of plastic which 1) is hard, 2) has an irregular shape, and 3) has broken off of a larger piece of plastic.

label: plastic line
definition: A piece of plastic which is linear and flexible.

label: plastic pellet
SYNONYMS: mermaid's tears|pellet de plástico|pellet di plastica|resin bead
definition: A piece of plastic which is 1) hard, 2) has a smooth external surface, and 3) has a roughly spherical or granular shape.

label: water column
definition: A liquid astronomical body part which 1) vertically spans a water body and 2) has fiat boundaries approximating a columnar shape.

label: biota
definition: A collection of organisms which inhabits the same region, ecosystem, or time period.

label: marine biota
definition: A biota which inhabits a marine ecosystem.

label: biodegradation
definition: A biological process during which a material entity is broken down.

label: biodegradation of plastic
SYNONYMS: Biologischer Plastikabbauprozess|biodegradación del plástico|biodegradazione della plastica|biological degradation of plastics
definition: A biodegradation process during which plastic is broken down.

label: foamed plastic
definition: A plastic which has a matrix- or sponge-like structure with numerous, hollow internal spaces.

label: quality of a foam
definition: A physical quality which inheres in a liquid or solid bearer by virtue of that bearer trapping a gas in a colloidal suspension throughout its volume.

label: ingestion
definition: A feeding behavior during which material is taken into the body of an organism.

label: adsorption
definition: A material accumulation process during which material adheres to a solid or liquid surface.

label: fouling
definition: A material accumulation process during which material builds up on a solid surface such that a function of that surface, or the object it is a part of, is impaired.

label: biofouling
definition: A fouling process during which biological matter accumulates on a solid surface.

label: granule of plastic foam
definition: A piece of plastic foam which has a near-spherical or granular shape.

label: fragmentation process
definition: An environmental system process during which a material entity breaks into pieces or parts.

label: fragmentation due to weathering
definition: A fragmentation process which is caused by weathering.

label: plastic
definition: An environnmental material which 1) is composed primarily of polymers with high molecular mass and 2) once deformed does not spontaneously return to its original shape.

label: megaplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which is greater than 1 metre in its longest dimension.

label: macroplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which is between 25 and 1000 millimetres in its longest dimension.

label: mesoplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which is between 5 and 25 millimetres in its longest dimension.

label: nanoplastic particle
definition: A piece of plastic which has a diameter less than 1 micrometre.

label: plastisphere
definition: A part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the entities which are composed primarily of plastic and which are within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body.

label: marine anthropogenic litter
definition: Anthropogenic litter which is present in the marine environment.

label: littering
definition: An anthropogenic environmental process during which waste is improperly disposed of into the environment.

label: litter role
definition: A role which 1) inheres in a material entity 2) is realised when that entity is discarded outside waste management systems by humans or their technologies.

label: manufactured plastisphere
definition: A plastisphere which is composed primarily of manufactured plastic.

label: natural plastic
definition: Plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by processes whose agents do not include humans or their technologies.

label: synthetic plastic
definition: A plastic which is composed primarily of polymers produced by a manufacturing process.

label: fishing
definition: A planned environmental usage process during which any number of fish are caught by humans or their technologies.

label: ghost fishing
definition: An anthropogenic environmental process during which abandoned, lost, or discarded fishing gear attracts and entangles organisms.

label: fishing gear
SYNONYMS: Angelausrüstung|Angelzubehör|Fischereiausrüstung|attrezzo di pesca|equipo de pesca|fishing tackle|漁具
definition: A manufactured product which is used for fishing.

label: discarded fishing gear
SYNONYMS: attrezzo di pesca scartato|entsorgte Angelausrüstung|equipo de pesca desechado|weggeworfene Angelausrüstung|weggeworfene Fischerreiausrüstung|weggeworfenes Angelzubehör
definition: Abandoned fishing gear which was intentionally left unmaintained and uncontrolled by its custodian.

label: abandoned fishing gear
definition: Fishing gear which is not under the control of or maintained by its custodian.

label: lost fishing gear
SYNONYMS: attrezzo di pesca perso|equipo de pesca perdido|verschollene Angelausrüstung
definition: Abandoned fishing gear which was unintentionally left unmaintained and uncontrolled by its custodian.

label: weathering
definition: A material transformation process during which the properties of a material are changed as a result of in situ exposure to atmospheric processes.

label: entanglement process
definition: An environmental system process during which material entities become entrapped, wrapped, twisted, entwined, or otherwise caught in one another.

label: entanglement of organisms in marine debris
definition: An entanglement process during which organisms become entrapped in anthropogenic marine debris.

label: biopolymer
definition: A polymer which is the output of a biological process.

label: synthetic polymer
definition: A polymer which is the output of a manufacturing process.

label: coastal anthropogenic litter
definition: Anthropogenic litter which is present in a coastal environment.

label: plastic manufacturing process
SYNONYMS: Plastikherstellung|plastic production|producción de plástico|produzione di plastica
definition: A manufacturing process which includes plastic as one of its specified outputs.

label: weathering of plastic
definition: Weathering during which plastic is worn or broken down.
